pages.text: Columns are usual Greco-Roman architectural elements. We add three types of columns in four materials: quartz, calcite, stone, felsic_tuff.
Columns are built with three parts: capital, shaft and plinth. These can be made of there material in the stonecutter, quartz columns require smooth quartz block.
The Ionian column has a classic spiral capital and fluted shaft.
The Tuscan column has no complicated carvings on the capital, and the column shaft are not fluted. So its visual effect is relatively simple.
This type of column does not exist in reality.Its prototype is the Collins column. There are some leaf pattern relief on the capitail while it's shaft is fluted.
